SaveFromAbsolute.synopsis: The player can talk to Minsc after the fight with Not-Jaheira and the Bhaal cultists. The player can persuade the Emperor to protect Minsc from the Absolute's influence
SaveFromAbsolute.how_to_trigger: Knock Minsc out while he is hostile to the player. Afterwards, use the Help action on him to wake him up

SaveFromAbsolute_23.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_23.text: *His mind is a seething mass of rage and confusion. The Absolute's influence cannot be broken without the Astral Prism.*

SaveFromAbsolute_109.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_109.text: *His mind is a seething mass of rage and confusion. The Absolute's influence cannot be broken without the Astral Prism.*

SaveFromAbsolute_17.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knocked flat, Minsc levers himself to all fours with great effort.

SaveFromAbsolute_85.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_85.text: Try to protect him, I must defy my Urge.

SaveFromAbsolute_123.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_123.text: You will do as I command, or I will find a way without you.

SaveFromAbsolute_0.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_0.text: Counter with an image of your own: Jaheira, alive and well, your ally in the fight against the Absolute.

SaveFromAbsolute_73.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_73.text: And she, I think, will be happy to see someone else.

SaveFromAbsolute_19.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_19.text: There's a fight coming. I want every sword-arm I can get.

SaveFromAbsolute_113.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_113.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down as if searching for something, nonchalant - then with growing concern, trailing off

SaveFromAbsolute_95.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_95.context: NodeContext: Running off at end of dialogue as if we weren't just mid-conversation.

SaveFromAbsolute_74.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_74.text: Because I'm infected too - I know your actions weren't your own.

SaveFromAbsolute_53.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_53.text: Honestly? I'm now wondering the very same thing.

SaveFromAbsolute_89.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_89.text: I saved her, you big lumbering fool.

SaveFromAbsolute_161.text: No. You are mistaken. It is my job to protect you - sometimes even from yourself.

SaveFromAbsolute_2.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc finally makes it to his feet, then attacks player.

SaveFromAbsolute_67.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_67.text: His chaos saved the city before. We need him.

SaveFromAbsolute_158.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_158.text: You're right. We can't risk it.

SaveFromAbsolute_64.text: We can't save everyone. The least we can do is put him out of his misery before we move on.

SaveFromAbsolute_88.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_88.text: *As if in response, Minsc's rage burns colder, burrows deeper, searching for something within you to break itself upon. And finding only -*

SaveFromAbsolute_138.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_138.text: *The simple truth. Jaheira, dead at your hand.*

SaveFromAbsolute_108.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_108.text: *Jaheira, left to die out in the shadow-lands. No different than murder, to a mind like Minsc's.*

SaveFromAbsolute_110.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_110.text: *Jaheira's false face, dead here at your feet. And no true Jaheira to name you friend.*

SaveFromAbsolute_160.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_160.text: Help him - protect him the way you do me.

SaveFromAbsolute_8.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_8.text: He's too far gone. Better to end it, for his sake.

SaveFromAbsolute_26.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knocked flat, Minsc levers himself to all fours with great effort.

SaveFromAbsolute_117.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_117.text: *Against the darkness swarming his senses, a single light glows - rage, flaring brighter every moment.*

SaveFromAbsolute_29.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: On all fours, head down, building into rage
[Ideal - shot of dead doppel-Jaheira, if we can cheat its location]

SaveFromAbsolute_124.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_124.text: He won't stay down for long. Tell your illithid to protect him from the elder brain's influence. Quickly.

SaveFromAbsolute_24.text: No. This one will not aid our cause. Get rid of him.

SaveFromAbsolute_128.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_128.text: *This wretch has stood against your Father before - you tremble to end him, every part of your rancorous body yearns for it.*

SaveFromAbsolute_49.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_49.context: NodeContext: Levers himself from all fours to kneeling up, howling in rage

SaveFromAbsolute_21.text: Don't be foolish. He is too unpredictable - he will only be a hindrance to us.

SaveFromAbsolute_112.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_112.text: His unpredictability saved the city before. We need him.

SaveFromAbsolute_136.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_136.text: Perhaps you're right. It may be too big a risk.

SaveFromAbsolute_32.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_32.text: Wretched, mangled pile of good, I should end him.

SaveFromAbsolute_52.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_52.text: You will do as I command.

SaveFromAbsolute_59.text: No. I will not be coerced into protecting him.

SaveFromAbsolute_12.text: You do not see what I do - his thoughts, his mind. Pure chaos.

SaveFromAbsolute_140.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_140.text: The mind flayer pours poison in your ear, I think.

SaveFromAbsolute_106.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_106.text: Tell it I will tear the Prism from your grasp and throw it in the deepest lava pit I can find.

SaveFromAbsolute_116.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_116.text: Long after our bones are dust and ash, the walls of its prison will still be burning.

SaveFromAbsolute_105.text: She bluffs. Surely she would not risk the fate of all for one simple life...

SaveFromAbsolute_122.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_122.text: Would you really doom us all to save him, Jaheira?

SaveFromAbsolute_132.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_132.text: *For a brief moment the lines on her face look deeper, her eyes full of pleading.*

SaveFromAbsolute_39.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_39.text: *For a brief moment, the lines on her face seem deeper. The great Jaheira looks like nothing so much as an old, worn woman.*

SaveFromAbsolute_115.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_115.text: *His mind unfolds beneath yours, a still lake pulls you down into its depths. Images flash by - battles fought, and friends fallen.*
SaveFromAbsolute_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still kneeling, Minsc rears back - eyes glowing purple with the force of the mind-meld.

SaveFromAbsolute_114.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_114.text: *His rage grows colder, burrows deeper, as a familiar face crystallizes before you.*
SaveFromAbsolute_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Straining, forces his gaze back down to glare at us - and slowly struggles to his feet.

SaveFromAbsolute_80.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looms in front of us, face contorted and eyes still glowing as he holds his weapon to strike.NodeContext: Height of savage rage - he believes we killed Jaheira, when we in fact just killed a doppelganger who looked like her

SaveFromAbsolute_3.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira steps between Minsc and player, facing him down.

SaveFromAbsolute_42.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_42.text: *The instant's hesitation is enough: with a sensation of terrible rending, something vast and nameless falls away from his mind.*
SaveFromAbsolute_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc stalls with his weapon raised, confused.

SaveFromAbsolute_118.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_118.context: NodeContext: Gripping his head in half pain, half fury - but both fading rapidly as he looks around in slight confusion. Berserker roar peters out into a bemused grunt

SaveFromAbsolute_37.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_37.text: Good. That means you're back to your old ways.

SaveFromAbsolute_11.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_11.text: We have a lot to discuss but first, you have someone to thank.
SaveFromAbsolute_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira holds up her hand to forestall him, then steps aside again to reveal the player.

SaveFromAbsolute_61.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_61.text: *In the sudden silence, your minds merge once more. More memories, sensations, but passing too quickly for you to track.*

SaveFromAbsolute_22.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_22.text: *In the same breath, you share everything that happened to you. The nautiloid. The Absolute. The Chosen of the Dead Three. *

SaveFromAbsolute_40.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_40.text: You. You saved Minsc while he danced like a mind flayer's meat-puppet. Why?
SaveFromAbsolute_40.context: NodeContext: Looks at us with fresh eyes - urgently wondering why we would save him when we were so insistent he be killed.

SaveFromAbsolute_66.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_66.text: You do well to heed her. Jaheira was very wise even before she was very old.
SaveFromAbsolute_66.context: NodeContext: Nodding, happy to hear Jaheira's name. No insult meant in his words.

SaveFromAbsolute_58.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_58.text: There is someone you must meet.

SaveFromAbsolute_102.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_102.text: There's a fight coming. I want every sword-arm I can get.

SaveFromAbsolute_119.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_119.text: Then you have two, and as many more as I can rip from enemy shoulders. But I have more than Minsc alone to offer.

SaveFromAbsolute_36.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_36.text: Because I'm infected too - I know your actions weren't your own.

SaveFromAbsolute_30.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_30.text: A level head and a kind heart. It is well that Boo kept me from crushing either.

SaveFromAbsolute_145.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_145.text: I would be rid of this parasite. Minsc takes orders from only one tiny beast, and he is much cuter than any mind-maggot.

SaveFromAbsolute_31.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_31.text: Honestly? I'm now wondering the very same thing.

SaveFromAbsolute_28.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_28.text: Whatever your reasons, it is more than Minsc alone that you have saved.

SaveFromAbsolute_99.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Patting himself down as if searching for something, nonchalant - then with growing concern, trailing off

SaveFromAbsolute_137.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Running off at end of dialogue as if we weren't just mid-conversation.

SaveFromAbsolute_127.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_127.text: The Emperor doesn't want to. I think its reasons are the right ones.

SaveFromAbsolute_76.speaker: Jaheira
SaveFromAbsolute_76.text: ...So be it. At least let me be the one to strike the final blow.

SaveFromAbsolute_130.speaker: Minsc
SaveFromAbsolute_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc finally makes it to his feet, then attacks player.

SaveFromAbsolute_45.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_45.text: *No answer - and not the faintest flicker of doubt.*

SaveFromAbsolute_62.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_62.text: I don't think you want to find out.

SaveFromAbsolute_18.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_18.text: Enough. The Emperor says his chaos will upset our plans. I believe it.

SaveFromAbsolute_121.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_121.text: I must end him... My body is telling me to end him...

SaveFromAbsolute_120.speaker: Narrator
SaveFromAbsolute_120.text: *Hate! Hate! Hate the ones who stood against Father!*

SaveFromAbsolute_79.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_79.text: He's too far gone. Better to end it, for his sake.

SaveFromAbsolute_154.speaker: Player
SaveFromAbsolute_154.text: Try to protect him, I must defy my Urge.
